section.name: Branches
section.p: JSPWiki branches are named in ALL CAPS, and are named JSPWIKI_X_Y_BRANCH. Whenever a stable release is cut, the code is branched and named accordingly. For example, you may access the JSPWiki 2.8 code branch from
Future stable releases are then cut from the stable branch, and have an increasing minor revision (e.g. 2.8.1, 2.8.2, etc).

section.name: Tags
section.p: Similarly, all releases are tagged when made. The naming convention is simple: jspwiki_x_y_z_n, where x,y and z are revision numbers, and n is a release designator (alpha,beta,incubating). For example, you may check out the 2.8.2 stable release by using the following URL:

section.name: European mirror
section.p: If you are located in Europe, you are highly encouraged to use the European mirror, as this will lower the load on the US server, and will also be considerably faster for you.

The mirror is synced every few minutes, so in practice you won't see a difference in the repository contents. The only time this might be a problem is if you do an "svn update" right after an "svn commit", but a better workflow would be to update before committing.
